templateOptions.label: 4.1.3 Minimisation of risk or inconvenience greater than the minimum

fieldGroup.template: What mechanisms have been planned to reduce the risk or inconvenience that has been classified as above the minimum?

The criterion of non-maleficence in research (do no harm and apply good scientific practices) implies that no harm should be caused to research subjects.

When the risk or inconvenience is inconsistent with the research itself, it is the responsibility of the principal investigator to reduce it to a minimum. For example: applying anaesthesia in invasive interventions to obtain samples, having rescue treatment for possible adverse events (from anaphylactic shock to anxiety crises), preserving privacy if talking about and collecting sensitive personal data, monitoring vital signs when performing physical tests, maintaining the presence of parents or guardians in vulnerable populations, etc.
